column26: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; Time of day determines Arabidopsis transcriptome and growth dynamics under mild drought
column27: Time of day determines Arabidopsis transcriptome and growth dynamics under mild drought
column28: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; Time of day determines Arabidopsis transcriptome and growth dynamics under mild drought
column29: Protocols: Four third leaves were harvested The third true leaf, composed of proliferating and expanding cells at the moment of harvesting were dissected and flash frozen in liquid nitrogen immediately upon harvest. The seeds were sown in 85g +/- 1g of Saniflor compost (Van Isreal N.V., Geraardsbergen, Belgium) with an absolute water content of +/- 70%. The seeds were covered with plastic foil until 5 DAS, when the automated watering was started. When runs with mutants were performed, the pots were randomized to homogenously mix mutant and wild-type plants. All plants were watered daily from 5 days after stratification (DAS) until 11 DAS with a WW regime of 2.2 gwater/gsoil. At 12 DAS, half of the pots (random positions) were maintained at the WW regime, while the other half were not watered until the end of the experiment at 17 DAS. Arabidopsis Col-0 were grown under a long-day regime (light from 6AM until 10PM, intensity 110-120 μmol m-2 s-1) at 21°C. All reported experiments were performed on the WIWAM platform (http://www.wiwam.be). In our setup, four seedlings were grown per pot in order to grow 864 seedlings simultaneously on the platform. All plants were watered daily from 5 days after stratification (DAS) until 11 DAS with a WW regime of 2.2 gwater/gsoil. At 12 DAS, half of the pots (random positions) were maintained at the WW regime, while the other half were not watered until the end of the experiment at 17 DAS. RNA was extracted using Trizol (Invitrogen) accor...

column27: Time of day determines Arabidopsis transcriptome and growth dynamics under mild drought
column28: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; Time of day determines Arabidopsis transcriptome and growth dynamics under mild drought
column29: Protocols: Four third leaves were harvested The third true leaf, composed of proliferating and expanding cells at the moment of harvesting were dissected and flash frozen in liquid nitrogen immediately upon harvest. The seeds were sown in 85g +/- 1g of Saniflor compost (Van Isreal N.V., Geraardsbergen, Belgium) with an absolute water content of +/- 70%. The seeds were covered with plastic foil until 5 DAS, when the automated watering was started. When runs with mutants were performed, the pots were randomized to homogenously mix mutant and wild-type plants. All plants were watered daily from 5 days after stratification (DAS) until 11 DAS with a WW regime of 2.2 gwater/gsoil. At 12 DAS, half of the pots (random positions) were maintained at the WW regime, while the other half were not watered until the end of the experiment at 17 DAS. Arabidopsis Col-0 were grown under a long-day regime (light from 6AM until 10PM, intensity 110-120 μmol m-2 s-1) at 21°C. All reported experiments were performed on the WIWAM platform (http://www.wiwam.be). In our setup, four seedlings were grown per pot in order to grow 864 seedlings simultaneously on the platform. All plants were watered daily from 5 days after stratification (DAS) until 11 DAS with a WW regime of 2.2 gwater/gsoil. At 12 DAS, half of the pots (random positions) were maintained at the WW regime, while the other half were not watered until the end of the experiment at 17 DAS. RNA was extracted using Trizol (Invitrogen) accor...
